title: Is the coronavirus (COVID-19) transmitted by food? - Quora

response.answer_text: SARS-Cov-2 (the virus that causes Covid-19) binds to the ACE2 receptors which, in addition to existing on cells throughout the respiratory system, exists on cells lining the gut (and circulatory system).After the pandemic got rolling, doctors reviewed records and found that many patients diagnosed with COVID-19 had originally sought medical treatment for digestive system complaints.From these two points alone, it’s baffling how anyone can say “we have no evidence to suggest the transmission of COVID-19 via food.” We do. These observations are direct evidence suggesting transmission via food. Now, having said that, “suggest” does not mean “prove.” Viruses are pretty feeble, and the things we eat are exactly the sorts of things that chemically, should bind to and quickly destroy virus particles. So while we have evidence suggesting transmission via food, we have evidence suggesting that’s unlikely. But “unlikely” does not mean impossible. Washing or otherwise sanitizing your food makes sense, especially if you are at particular risk. But at the same time, you should not injure or poison yourself in the process, and should consider that with the risk of contamination through food being logically very low, and the fact that the odds of your innate immunity handling trivial amounts of virus or weakened virus with no problem, this is not something you should be loosing sleep over. That said, I routinely wash, repackage, or irradiate with UV-C light all items entering my home, and have done since the middle of March.
